New Records: Anrich Nortje produced a career-best performance in T20Is with 4/7 in four overs, helping South Africa bowl Sri Lanka out for 77.
South Africa bowled Sri Lanka out for their lowest total in men's T20Is during the match.
Key Match Events: South Africa's bowlers, led by Anrich Nortje and Ottneil Baartman, delivered a masterclass, taking key wickets and restricting Sri Lanka to a low total.
The chase of 78 by South Africa was steady and confident, with Quinton de Kock anchoring the innings and Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller contributing to the victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka won the toss and elected to bat first, but faced early pressure from South Africa's bowlers, who extracted extra bounce from the wicket.
Keshav Maharaj and Anrich Nortje made quick breakthroughs, leaving Sri Lanka's innings in tatters.
Post-Match Reflections: Anrich Nortje was awarded the Player of the Match for his exceptional performance.
South Africa's victory marked a winning start to their campaign, and they look to build on this performance in their next matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a low-scoring thriller, with South Africa and Sri Lanka struggling to score on a surface offering plenty for quicks and spinners.
This was the first T20 World Cup match held in New York, marking a historic moment in the tournament.
